meanings.def: to state clearly and definitely that something is true
examples: assert that… She continued to assert that she was innocent.
The report asserts confidently that the industry will grow.
assert something She continued to assert her innocence.
The German Chancellor was anxious to assert her government's commitment to European unity.
it is asserted that… It is commonly asserted that older people prefer to receive care from family members.

meanings.def: to behave in a confident and determined way so that other people pay attention to your opinions
examples: You’re too timid—you must try to assert yourself more.

meanings.def: to make other people recognize your right or authority to do something, by behaving in a determined and confident way
examples: I was determined to assert my authority from the beginning.
She wished to assert her independence from her parents.
He managed to assert his power over the media.
They successfully asserted their right to protect their homes.

meanings.def: to start to have an effect
